sen.j: 当時の熱田大宮司家は、男子は後に後白河天皇の北面武士となるものが多く、女子には後白河院母の藤原璋子や姉の統子内親王につかえる女房がいるため待賢門院や後白河院・上西門院に近い立場にあったと思われる。
sen.e: From the Atsuta-Daiguji family in those days, many men became Hokumen no Bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards) of the Emperor Goshirakawa and some women became court ladies who served FUJIWARA no Shoshi, the mother of the retired emperor Goshirakawa, and the Imperial Princess Muneko, his sister, so that it seems that the Atsuta-Daiguji family was near to Taikenmon-in (FUJIWARA no Shoshi), the retired emperor Goshirakawa and Josaimon-in (Imperial Princess Muneko).

sen.e: In the Hogen War of 1156, the Atsuta-Daiguji family, the family home of Yura gozen, sent troops to Yoshitomo and helped him ('Hogen Monogatari' (The Tale of the Hogen War)).

sen.j: また、由良御前の子である源頼朝は保元3年（1158年）熱田大宮司家と縁の深い統子内親王の立后にあたり皇后に仕える「皇后宮少進」に任命された。
sen.e: In addition, MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, a son of Yura gozen, was assigned to 'Kogogushojo,' who served an empress, when the Imperial Princess Muneko, who had deeply related with the Atsuta-Daiguji family, became an empress in 1158.

sen.j: 翌保元4年（1159年）2月統子内親王が女院号宣下されると頼朝はその蔵人に任命された。
sen.e: When the Imperial Princess Muneko was given a title of nyoingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) on February or March in the following year, 1159, Yoritomo was assigned to her Kurodo (Chamberlain).
